column2: Comments
Take extra care to setup “initial sample volume” and specify which size of DNA to preserve. The rest of the parameters are standard and rarely changed.

1=yes, 0=no. If “1”, the robot will perform initial checkup before physically starting the protocol. You can review the checkup result and chose to proceed or abort. Select “0” if you are sure all parameters are correct
If you placed a new tip box before the purification, select “1”. If partially used tip box remains from the previous purification, select “0”.
uL. How much of the beads is present
“eppendorf” for 1.5 mL eppendorf tube, "5mL", "15mL", "25mL", "50mL" for the corresponding tube type
Which rack is the tube found. Possible values are "samples" and "reagents"
always "0" for "reagents" rack, specify "1" for "samples" rack
“ep” for 1.5 mL eppendorf tube, "5mL", "15mL", "25mL", "50mL" for the corresponding tube type
Which rack is the tube found. Possible values are "samples" and "reagents"
uL. How much of the eluent is present. If value is < 0, the value from a previous experiment is used (careful, as liquid could evaporate)
“ep” for 1.5 mL eppendorf tube, "5mL", "15mL", "25mL", "50mL" for the corresponding tube type
Which rack is the tube found. Possible values are "samples" and "reagents"
uL. How much of the ethanol is present. If value is < 0, the value from a previous experiment is used (careful, as liquid could evaporate)
“eppendorf” for 1.5 mL eppendorf tube
Samples with values <= 0 will not be purified, the rest of the parameters for those samples will be ignored
Will retain all DNA shorter than this value. Used if “fraction” or “bead volume” is not provided

How much volume of the beads suspension to add, relative to the sample volume. Example: sample volume = 30 uL, fraction = 0.5, then 15 uL of beads suspension will be added. Overrides “DNA size cutoff” value, but is ignored if “beads volume” is provided.
How much volume of the beads suspension to add. If provided, overrides DNA size cutoff and Fraction.
Will retain all DNA longer than this value. Used if “fraction” or “bead volume” is not provided

How much volume of the beads suspension to add for the long DNA cutoff, relative to the sample volume. Example: sample volume = 30 uL, fraction = 0.5, then 15 uL of beads suspension will be added. Overrides “DNA size cutoff” value, but is ignored if “beads volume” is provided.
How much volume of the beads suspension to add for the long DNA cutoff. If provided, overrides DNA size cutoff and Fraction.
How long to wait after adding the beads to the sample, in minutes. Count starts after initial mixing is done.
While waiting for absorption, the robot will attempt to mix the samples this many times.
After beads are moved towards the sample, how long to wait for the beads to pull towards the side of the tube, in minutes.

How many times to repeat a mixing cycle. Put more if you notice robot is not properly resuspending the beads during elution.
While waiting for elution, the robot will attempt to mix the samples this many times.
Keep “auto” value unless you know what you are doing. Option to manually provide a port name, such as COM3. Useful if you have several serial port devices simultaneously connected to this computer.
